abstract: National Assn of Realtors reports that sales of existing homes increased 2.4 percent to annual rate of 5.04 million units in December 2014, but warns that housing recovery in United States will remain gradual due to apprehension of first-time home buyers.
lead_paragraph: Sales of existing homes increased 2.4 percent to an annual rate of 5.04 million units in December, the National Association of Realtors said.
snippet: Sales of existing homes increased 2.4 percent to an annual rate of 5.04 million units in December, the National Association of Realtors said.

headline.main: Home Sales Rise, but First-Time Buyers Remain Few
headline.print_headline: Home Sales Rise, but First-Time Buyers Remain Few
